NAME: Name
ORDER_TOOLTIP:
Load Order

Displays a sorted list of plugins modifying this form, based on load order. This can help identify the origin of a form.

This list does not utilize any of the Modex Plugin user settings such as sorting direction.
DESCRIPTION_TOOLTIP:
Description

Attempts to dynamically display the description for a Form. Values are calculated from Base MGEF values, and won't reflect real-time modifiers such as perks, player level, etc.
KIT_CREATE_TOOLTIP:
Create New Kit

Create a new empty kit to add items to.
KIT_RENAME_TOOLTIP:
Rename Kit

Rename the selected kit or move it into a collection (subfolder).
KIT_DELETE_TOOLTIP:
Delete Kit

Permanently delete the selected kit from your 'equipment' folder.
KIT_COPY_TOOLTIP:
Copy Kit

Create a copy of the selected kit in your 'equipment' folder.
KIT_BROWSE_TOOLTIP:
Browse Kits

Open the kit browser to view and manage your kits and collections.
POPUP_KIT_RENAME_DESC:
Enter the new name for the selected kit. You can also include a relative path to move the kit into a collection (subfolder). For example:

'NewKitName'
'Armors/Heavy/NewKitName'

Kits are saved in the 'equipment' folder of Modex. The .json extension is optional when naming kits in-game.
POPUP_KIT_DELETE_DESC:
Are you sure you want to delete this kit?

This will permanently remove the kit from your 'equipment' folder and cannot be undone.
POPUP_KIT_CREATE_DESC:
Enter the name, including relative path, for the new kit. Kits will be saved in the 'equipment' folder of Modex. For example:

'IronArmor'
'StarterKit.json'

Collections can help organize kits by subfolders. For example:

'Armors/Heavy/IronArmor'
'MyCollection/KitName'

The .json extension is optional when naming kits in-game.
SET_START_EQUIP_TOOLTIP:
Set As Starting Equipment

Sets the selected kit as the starting equipment on game start. (UNIMPLEMENTED)
PLUGIN_DEPENDENCIES_TOOLTIP:
Plugin Dependencies

Show a list of all plugins that the selected item or kit depends on.
SHOW_ALL_TOOLTIP:
Show All

Display all items in the table, ignoring recent items.
Click To Toggle.
SHOW_RECENT_TOOLTIP:
Show Recent

Display recently used items in the table.
Click To Toggle.
CONTAINER_VIEW_TOOLTIP:
Container View

View the contents of the table results inside a chest.
CONTAINER_VIEW_KIT_TOOLTIP:
Container View

View the contents of the selected kit inside a chest.
ADD_KIT_TOOLTIP:
Add Kit

Add all items from the selected kit to an inventory.
ADD_KIT_NPC_TOOLTIP:
Add Kit To NPC

Add all items from the selected kit to the targeted NPC's inventory.
ADD_SELECTION_TOOLTIP:
Add Selection

Add the selected item(s) from the table to an inventory.
ADD_SELECTION_NPC_TOOLTIP:
Add Selection To NPC

Add the selected item(s) from the table to the targeted NPC.
CLEAR_INVENTORY_TOOLTIP:
Clear Inventory

Removes all items from an inventory.
CLEAR_INVENTORY_NPC_TOOLTIP:
Clear NPC Inventory

Removes all items from the targeted NPC's inventory.
RESET_INVENTORY_NPC_TOOLTIP:
Reset NPC Inventory

Resets the targeted NPC's inventory to its default state.
PLACE_SELECTION_TOOLTIP:
Place Selection

Place the selected item(s) from the table on the ground.
EQUIP_SELECTION_TOOLTIP:
Add & Equip

Add & Equip the selected item(s) from the table to the player directly.
EQUIP_SELECTION_NPC_TOOLTIP:
Add & Equip

Add & Equip the selected item(s) from the table to the targeted NPC directly.
GOTO_NPC_REFERENCE_TOOLTIP:
Goto NPC Reference

Teleports the player to the targeted NPC's current location in the world.
BRING_NPC_REFERENCE_TOOLTIP:
Bring NPC Reference

Teleports the targeted NPC to the player's current location in the world.
ENABLE_NPC_REFERENCE_TOOLTIP:
Enable NPC Reference

Enables the targeted NPC if they are disabled.
DISABLE_NPC_REFERENCE_TOOLTIP:
Disable NPC Reference

Disables the targeted NPC, making them invisible and non-interactive.
ADD_ALL_TOOLTIP:
Add All

Add all items from the table to an inventory.
PLACE_ALL_TOOLTIP:
Place All

Place all items from the table on the ground.
SETTINGS_INFO: All settings are saved automatically to "Data/Interface/Modex/User/Settings.json" in your relative Skyrim Special Edition directory.
SETTINGS_INFO_2: Everything can be configured through the menu settings. Editing the files directly may cause critical issues, and is not recommended.
SETTINGS_MENU_KEYBIND_INVALID:
Sorry! The keybind you pressed doesn't correspond to the assignment rules.

Invalid Hotkeys:
 - Escape
 - Tab
 - Enter
 - Space
 - T
 - <any modifier key>

Try again. If you're setting your Modifier hotkey, only these keys are valid:

 - Shift
 - Alt
 - Ctrl
SETTINGS_MENU_KEYBIND_DESC:
Waiting for user to press <Any> key...

Press <T> to revert to default hotkey.

Press <Esc> to close this popup.
SETTINGS_MENU_KEYBIND_TOOLTIP:
Show Menu Hotkey

The keybind used to open and close the Modex menu in-game.

Will only support keys recognized by Skyrim.

If a modifier is set below, both keys must be pressed to open the menu. Pressing <T> while hovering over a Hotkey will reset it to default.

If you break something, you can always edit the settings.json directly. (Requires Restart)
SETTINGS_MENU_MODIFIER_TOOLTIP:
Show Menu Modifier

Not Required. Can only be set to Ctrl, Alt, or Shift. If you use Alt, you may want to disable 'Alt' behavior in 'General Behaviors'.

Note: There is no Left/Right discrimination for modifier keys. For example, 'Shift' works with both 'L-Shift' and 'R-Shift'.
SETTINGS_SORT_TOOLTIP:
Plugin List - Sort Direction

Determines the sorting for any list populated with plugins.
- Table Plugin Selection Dropdown
- Blacklist Settings
SETTINGS_BASE_PLUGIN_TOOLTIP:
Plugin List - Use Base Plugin

(REQUIRES RESTART)

When enabled, forms will be indexed by their BASE plugin instead of the LAST plugin to modify them.

E.g. 'Banded Iron Armor' will always be located in 'Skyrim.esm' even if 'Update.esm' modifies it. If this option is disabled, then it will be categorized under the last plugin that modified the form.
SETTINGS_DISABLE_IN_MENU: Prevent Modex from Opening over Skyrim Menu's
SETTINGS_DISABLE_IN_MENU_TOOLTIP:
Disable Inside Menu(s)

This setting will disable Modex from opening while any other Skyrim Game menu is open. E.g.

- Journal Menu
- Console
- Time Skip Menu
- Inventory
- System Menu
SETTINGS_LOG_LEVEL_TOOLTIP:
Modex Log Level

Controls what level of information is outputted to the log file. (Trace = Maximum). Typically this can remain off, or set to Info. Any option above Info is subject to potential performance impacts while Modex is being used.

I only recommend changing this if you encounter bugs, errors, or crashes and need more debugging information.
BLACKLIST_TYPE_TOOLTIP:
Plugin Type

This option will exclude plugins from showing in the tables below based on what option you select.

For example, if you only want to see plugins which contain 'Item' records for the Add Item module. Likewise, 'Actor' will only display plugins with Actor records in them.
BLACKLIST_SORT_TOOLTIP:
Sort Type

Sort the tables below based on this option. This does not apply universally to other layouts or tables!

If you want to change this for other modules and layouts, go to the Settings page.
BLACKLIST_SEARCH_TOOLTIP:
Fuzzy Plugin Search

This field allows you to fuzzily search through recognized plugins. It uses a straightforward string comparison function.
BLACKLIST_DESCRIPTION: This window is responsible for hiding unecessary, unwanted plugins while interacting with Modex. The intended use-case for this setting is to hide plugins which contain mostly unusable or irrelevant forms. A good example of this would be patches, replacers, frameworks, or plugins containing dummy forms only. Typically as you use the module and scroll over hundreds and thousands of forms, you'll notice some plugins contain heaps of useless items, objects, or actors that clutter your results. This is why I made this.
TABLE_SEARCH_TOOLTIP:
Search Field

Type to search within the currently shown Plugin, based on the Property specified to the left.

Press 'Enter' to submit your search query. You can optionally enable 'QuickSearch' to automatically filter results as you type.

For advanced features, read the Wiki.
TABLE_KEY_TOOLTIP:
Search Key

Determines which property of listed items to apply your search to.

E.g. 'Name' will search item names, while 'EditorID' will search editor IDs.
TABLE_PLUGIN_TOOLTIP:
Plugin Search Field

Select a Plugin from the dropdown to filter the table results to only show items from that specific plugin.

You can also select 'Showing All' to include all loaded plugins in the search. This is useful if you want to search across multiple plugins without restricting yourself to just one.

This list is built based on the module you're using. Therefore, it will NOT show all plugins in your Load Order. It displays plugins which contains forms relevant to the current module only.
STATUS_BAR_LINK:
Target Reference Shared

Indicates whether this table shares a Target Reference or not.

Tables that don't share references need to be assigned separately
STATUS_BAR_TOOLTIP:
Target Reference

This represents the targeted Actor or Container to operate upon. Click to manually enter.

<T> Set to Player
<C> Set to Console Reference
<Shift> + <LMB> Copy FormID
<Ctrl> + <LMB> Set to shared target.
STATUS_BAR_DESC:
Manually set the Target Reference by FormID.

- Must be a 'Reference' FormID.

- Hexidecimal (e.g. FF001234).

- Can be Shortened (e.g. 14).

- Must be 'loaded'.

If Modex is unable to locate the Target based on your input, a warning will appear with more details.
ADD_AMOUNT_TOOLTIP:
Amount To Add

The number of items to be added upon activation of action.
kPlugin_TOOLTIP: Plugin: The source plugin file where the Form is defined. (e.g. ESM, ESP, ESL).
kFormID_TOOLTIP: Form ID: The unique hexadecimal identifier for the Form within the game.
kName_TOOLTIP: Name: The (FULL) Fullname record of a Form. Modex will default to (EDID) Editor ID if empty.
kEditorID_TOOLTIP: Editor ID: An identifier assigned to a form/record for use in editors.
kFormType_TOOLTIP: Form Type: Four letter code representing the Type of Form. (e.g. WEAP, ARMO, OTFT).
kWeaponDamage_TOOLTIP: Weapon Damage: The base damage value of the weapon before any skill or perk modifiers.
kWeaponSpeed_TOOLTIP: Weapon Speed: The speed at which the weapon can be swung or fired.
kWeaponType_TOOLTIP: Weapon Type: The engines classification of a weapon. Mods primarily use Keywords.
kWeaponSkill_TOOLTIP: Weapon Skill: The skill associated with the weapon for damage calculations (e.g. One-Handed, Two-Handed).
kWeaponCriticalDamage_TOOLTIP: Weapon Critical Damage: The damage modifier applied on critical hits.
kWeaponDamagePerSecond_TOOLTIP: Weapon DPS: Simple measure of weapon speed multiplied by weapon damage.
kWeaponRange_TOOLTIP: Weapon Range: The distance the weapon can effectively hit, measured in game units.
kWeaponStagger_TOOLTIP: Weapon Stagger: The amount of stagger inflicted on a target (UNTESTED).
kArmorRating_TOOLTIP: Armor Rating: The defensive value provided by the armor before any skill or perk modifiers.
kArmorSlot_TOOLTIP: Armor Slot: The body part where the armor piece is equipped (e.g. Head, Chest, Hands).
kArmorType_TOOLTIP: Armor Type: The engine classification of an armor. (e.g Light, Heavy).
kPlayable_TOOLTIP: Playable: Indicates whether the Form can be used or equipped by the player.
kEnchanted_TOOLTIP: Enchanted: Indicates whether the Form has an enchantment applied to it.
kGoldValue_TOOLTIP: Gold Value: The base monetary value of the Form. Modifiers may affect this value in-game.
kCarryWeight_TOOLTIP: Carry Weight: The weight of the Form, or the capacity of an Actor Inventory.
kReferenceID_TOOLTIP: Reference ID: The unique identifier for a specific instance of a Form or Actor in the game world.
kUnique_TOOLTIP: Unique: Indicates whether only one instance of the form can exist in the game world.
kEssential_TOOLTIP: Essential: Indicates whether the Actor cannot be killed.
kDisabled_TOOLTIP: Disabled: Indicates whether the Actor is currently disabled and non-interactive.
kHealth_TOOLTIP: Health: Refers to the Base Actor Value of Health.
kMagicka_TOOLTIP: Magicka: Refers to the Base Actor Value of Magicka.
kStamina_TOOLTIP: Stamina: Refers to the Base Actor Value of Stamina.
kRace_TOOLTIP: Race: The Race of an Actor.
kGender_TOOLTIP: Gender: The Gender of an Actor.
kClass_TOOLTIP: Class: The Class of an Actor.
kFaction_TOOLTIP: Faction: The Faction the Actor is assigned to.
kLevel_TOOLTIP: Level: The base level of an Actor. Does not refer to in-game references.
kCell_TOOLTIP: Cell: Represents a location, or the location of an Actor.
kLand_TOOLTIP: Land: Represents a large outdoor area or region containing cells.
kKeyword_TOOLTIP: Keyword: A unique tag associated to a Form to provide conditional logic for game systems and scripts.
kSpellCost_TOOLTIP: Spell Cost: The base cost of a Spell.
kSpellType_TOOLTIP: Spell Type: The classification of the spell. (e.g. Spell, Power, Ability).
kSpellCastType_TOOLTIP: Spell Cast Type: The type of spell cast. (e.g. Constant Effect, Fire and Forget).
kSpellDelivery_TOOLTIP: Spell Delivery: The method by which the spell effect is delivered (e.g. Self, Target, Aimed).
kTomeSpell_TOOLTIP: Spell: The spell that the item teaches when used.
kTomeSkill_TOOLTIP: Skill: The skill that the item improves when used.
kScrollSpell_TOOLTIP: Scroll: The spell that the scroll casts when used.
kSpellList_TOOLTIP: Spell List: The list of spells known to this Form. Does not represent real-time data from in-game references.
kKeywordList_TOOLTIP: Keywords: The list of keywords associated with this Form, used by many frameworks and game scripts to resolve logic.
kFactionList_TOOLTIP: Factions: A list of factions which an Actor is a member of. (Ranks Unsupported)
INVALID_REFERENCE_POPUP_DESC:
Modex could not resolve a valid Target Reference from your input. Try again, and ensure proper formatting is used.

If this is unexpected, you can use the in-game Console to select your target. Then press <C> while hovering the status bar to assign a Target Reference from your Console selection.

If all else fails, you can press <T> while hovering the status bar to quickly assign the Player reference.
WARNING_NO_ITEMS: No items found in the table matching the current criteria. If this is unexpected, check your search and plugin fields to confirm your query. It's likely you may be searching inside the wrong plugin, or searching by the wrong property (left-side drop-down box).
ERROR_NO_KIT_SELECTED: No Kit Selected: Select a kit to proceed.
ERROR_MISSING_REFERENCE: No Target Reference: Hover for details.
ERROR_INVALID_REFERENCE: Invalid Target: Must be an Actor or Container reference.
